James Bond.Action: Successfully climbs a dangerous 600-foot frozen waterfall using specialized equipment and physical skill.
After the ice shatters and falls away beneath him, Bond does not panic and attempts to regain footing and continue.
Mentally reflects on the difficulty of his task with humor, indicating self-awareness but not distraction.
Despite losing his grip and the ice wall shattering, Bond remains calm, thinks strategically, and uses a pendulum motion to attempt re-anchoring the ice pick.
Misses twice when trying to embed the second ice pick during the swing, putting his life at greater risk.
At the last critical moment, successfully hurls himself and drives the second ice pick into the ice just as the first tether snaps, saving himself from falling.
After climbing to the top, he breaks through the unstable ice despite exhaustion, demonstrating physical skill and determination.
Shrugs off difficult situation, prepares equipment efficiently and presses on with mission.
Unpacks and uses a high tech automatic rifle, sets up at a good vantage point, uses gun sight effectively to observe enemy activities from a distance.
Coordinates with MI6 by confirming position with voice over speaker, showing clear communication and discipline in operation.
Adjusts the knob on the scope precisely and zeroes in on targets as directed; follows tactical commands efficiently.
Obeys orders quickly and adapts to shifts in plan despite escalating situation.
Does not intervene or object when plan B is initiated due to assessment he may not handle more; no visible hesitation or error.
Disobeys direct order to exit target area, insists on staying despite risks.
Carefully observes enemy movements using scope and adjusts position accordingly.
Maintains focus and composure under intense pressure while observing the situation with the rifle scope.
Maintains focus through the rifle scope, carefully monitoring the target and assessing the situation before acting.
Replies 'Negative, one. NOT YET.' indicating withholding action until the right moment rather than rushing prematurely.
Throws a grenade to create a diversion, allowing others to escape.
Kills multiple men while running through chaos.
Carefully times and throws a grenade to create a diversion, then uses the confusion to sprint into the chaos.
While sprinting, quickly and accurately shoots multiple enemies without breaking stride.
Leaps to save the pilot, fights, kills enemy to prevent harm, acts decisively to take control of the plane and ensure mission success.

Leaps to seize the MiG pilot, kills him with a knife quickly and efficiently, throws the knife to kill an armed man approaching, incapacitates the copilot with a helmet bash, then pilots and takes off in the enemy aircraft under extreme pressure.
Shoves throttles to fireball and survives massive explosion, rockets MiG out of flames.
Goes into evasive maneuvers immediately when attacked by MiG-2.
Fights off copilot trying to strangle him with metal lanyard while piloting.
Uses red button ejector seat to blast copilot out of plane, causing enemy MiG-2 to be incapacitated.
Executes complex inverted flying maneuver to get behind enemy MiG-2, stunning its pilot.
Engages in playful, flirtatious banter with Jenny Wu, showing humor and lightheartedness.
Probes Jenny Wu with teasing but affectionate remarks, initiating intimacy in a friendly manner.
Uses sarcasm ('Thank the General for all his assistance') after a tense moment, implying a sarcastic but not hostile attitude.
Lighthearted teasing with Moneypenny about language lessons and joking tone on phone.
Waits patiently and lightly interacts with Jenny Wu while she dresses, showing amusement rather than impatience.
Answers phone promptly and acknowledges Moneypenny's call while managing a playful conversation and staying aware of his schedule.
Attempts to balance informal personal time with professional duties but shows readiness to comply with orders.
Delays a little by indicating he may take longer to finish 'lessons', showing some flexibility but risk of being late.
Politely interacts with Jenny Wu, showing cultural awareness by responding with 'Tsi tien' in return, and maintains composure in a social setting.
Leaves the scene calmly and proceeds to MI-6 for debriefing, showing professional discipline and readiness to engage in mission-related work.
Makes a sarcastic comment about imperialism promoting loyalty among the faithful.
Listens attentively during briefing, responds with a witty but informed comment on imperialism and loyalty, showing engagement and understanding.
Acknowledges M's request to exchange numbers for further info without hesitation, showing readiness and professionalism.
Engages Dominique in subtle but skillful interaction, recognizing unspoken tensions; notes wedding band and tactfully probes personal information without overstepping.
Shows signs of internal conflict (bittersweetness, remorse) momentarily, suggesting emotional distraction.
Keeps professional composure while maintaining charm during social interaction, demonstrating confidence and social skill.
Makes a lighthearted but contextually sharp comment to Moneypenny about hidden cameras, indicating situational awareness and wit.
Engages in playful, witty banter with Moneypenny, showing familiarity and a lighthearted rapport.
Responds evasively to personal questions, avoiding sincere or emotional disclosure.
Greets Minister Johnstone politely and acknowledges familiarity.
Makes a slightly sarcastic remark about newspapers when asked about Elliot Harmsway, showing a guarded attitude.
Answers Moneypenny with witty, confident remarks and maintains composure when interacting with senior officials.
Shows discretion by refusing to divulge past sensitive experiences (e.g., being stranded on a raft for two weeks).
Uses humor and charm effectively in professional settings, demonstrating social intelligence.
Engages with M and Minister Johnstone respectfully, asks clarifying questions to understand the situation.
Uses dry, somewhat skeptical humor about media power and journalism.
Remains neutral and professional during tense political discussion, avoids confrontation.
Asks M directly about what Harmsway has done, showing proactive information gathering and situational awareness.
Responds quizzically and makes a cautious, ironic comment about trusting newspapers, indicating critical thinking and awareness of misinformation.
Does not contradict Minister Johnstone's dismissive stance outright but remains skeptical, showing prudent judgment rather than rashness.
Responds courteously and professionally to M and Minister Johnstone.
Shows acceptance of sensitive mission instructions without complaint.
No visible friendly or warm interactions; remains formal and reserved.
Accepts a complex, sensitive mission involving international intrigue and covert investigation without hesitation.
Asks a practical question about how to meet the informant, showing attention to operational details.
Responds calmly and confidently to the high-level briefing by M and the Minister, indicating composure and understanding.
Comes to Saunders' aid with some light humor despite Saunders' visible pain and injuries.
Silent and somewhat chastised when M reprimands him on political realities.
Jokes lightly with Saunders despite his injuries, demonstrating confidence and camaraderie.
Is silent and chastised after M criticizes political naivety, showing awareness and restraint.
Expresses hope that the situation won't escalate, showing prudence and measured judgment.
Jokes about using explosive shoelaces to 'tie up a knotty problem', showing lightheartedness and friendly banter with Saunders.
Plays with the lighter toy and interacts casually and teasingly with Saunders, showing some degree of ease and sociability.
Shows mild amusement at Saunders' embarrassed confession about cash machine test, indicating tolerance and a non-judgmental attitude.
Tries to look inside the briefcase despite Saunders repositioning it, a subtle disregard for Saunders' boundaries, which could imply some lack of respect or trust.
Shows familiarity and confidence with new gadgets without needing a lengthy explanation; immediately understands the lighter's function and plays with it.
Jokes while examining the explosive shoelaces, implying quick understanding and ease with advanced weapons.
Quickly questions the practical application of the security card by asking if it works on cash machines, showing intelligent and practical thinking.
Turns from a devious grin to an amused M and smiles, replies with a light-hearted wedding ring pun and a sincere-sounding 'Till death do us part.'
Needles Saunders with a quip 'If you can't do the time, don't do the crime?'
Receives new gadgets including a watch with advanced features and a protective wedding band, responds with humor and confidence.
Navigates a crowded, chaotic masked celebration in Venice, actively searching for a contact despite difficult conditions.
Grabs Paris's wrist forcefully and interrogates her motives, expressing distrust and impatience.
Acknowledges Paris's attempt at friendliness but responds with skepticism and coldness.
Responds coldly and dismissively to Paris, saying 'Nothing' when asked if he misses her.
Slaps Paris when she becomes hysterical and asks for his help.
Feels remorse after slapping Paris and softens, showing a more tender side.
Reaches out to touch Paris and allows her to bury her face in his shoulder, then pats her head gently.
Gently pushes Paris away to look in her eyes and ask a serious question, showing control and composure.
Slaps Paris in anger during a tense emotional exchange, showing loss of control and insensitivity.
Remains focused on mission details (uranium on the boat, press conference), pushing past personal emotions to gather intelligence.
Carefully tests Paris by questioning her about Harmsway, demonstrating alertness and strategic thinking despite emotional distraction.
Allows himself to be baited and physically hurt by Paris, indicating a momentary lapse in emotional and physical defensiveness.
Blocks Stamper and thugs' view of the procession by throwing his cape dramatically, protecting others from potential danger.

Throws his cape up dramatically to block the view of approaching enemies, then pulls it to his body timed perfectly with the arrival of the carnival procession, using the crowd to overwhelm them and escape.
Offers to take a tourist's photo politely before using the camera's flash to blind the thug.
Uses presence of mind to distract thug with camera flash, then incapacitates him using a pushcart, and escapes skillfully through the crowd.
Knocks out thug to prevent attack without lethal force.
Effectively evades capture by ducking into shadows and shrinking back, showing awareness of surroundings.
Quickly responds to being grabbed by side-stepping, twisting out of a cloak trap, and knocking out the assailant with a head-first slam into a wall.
Quickly scans the courtyard and identifies the spiral staircase as the only escape route, then takes the steps two at a time.
Attempts to open locked doors but recognizes they are too heavy to force open, then looks for alternative escape on the roof.
Uses physical agility to climb from the balcony banister to the roof, evading pursuing thugs.
Navigates dangerous terrain (steep, sheer drops) to escape, demonstrating confidence and skill.
Struggles momentarily to regain foothold on the second roof but quickly recovers and continues escape.
Grasps the Thug's elbow and yanks his gun arm forward, pitches his head back to avoid gunfire, then uses a candelabra to disarm the thug.
Grabs the copper gutter at the last moment to avoid sliding off the roof.
Uses lightning speed to disarm the thug by yanking the elbow and avoiding the gunshot.
Smashes the candelabra against Thug's arm to knock the gun away.
Gets his gun wrestled from his hand by the thug despite prior maneuvers.
Fends off a thug using found objects in a violent fight to protect himself.
Quickly adapts to being disarmed by grabbing improvised weapons from the environment (oak leg, halberd, morning-star) and uses them skillfully in combat.
Is initially overpowered by the thug who easily takes his gun and knocks him down.
Shows presence of mind and agility by side-stepping the thug's attempt to push him into the iron maiden, avoiding serious injury or death.
Bends down to retrieve his gun from the victim after the fight and makes a dry comment: 'He fought hard... But the case was terminal.'
Engages professionally and politely with Signore DiGiacomo, confirming details and maintaining cooperative dialogue.
Agrees with DiGiacomo's plan to signal after the press conference, showing cooperation and trust in a delicate situation.
No evident display of friendliness, tolerance, or sincerity in interaction; mostly focused on operational concerns.
Confidently arranges a coordinated and discreet arrest plan with DiGiacomo, anticipating the need to wait until after the press conference to minimize complications.
Observes Harmsway carefully during the press conference, demonstrating situational awareness and intelligence.
Moves cautiously down a staircase and peers along a corridor, observing a guard checking doors and ensuring they're locked.
Moves cautiously and stealthily to avoid detection while gathering crucial intelligence.
Handles radioactive material carefully and respects safety protocols.

Moves stealthily and cautiously, uses a gadget to swipe a card reader, inspects a suspicious box for tampering, uses multiple Geiger counters to verify uranium slugs, quickly reacts to unexpected noise by slipping out the door calmly.
Tries to remain as inconspicuous as possible while blending in at the hospitality bar.
Responds to Valentin's unpleasant surprise with a curt greeting, showing irritation but no friendliness.
Quickly replaces the cutting saw and slips out undetected through the first door to escape.
Aims his watch at the cafe, identifying possible threats or surveillance.
Attempts to remain as inconspicuous as possible at the hospitality bar despite being in a potentially hostile environment.
Spins quickly to face Valentin the moment he is addressed, showing alertness.
Not directly reacting to the video surveillance camera scanning the deck beyond noticing it; no overt countermeasure taken.
Keeps an eye on the surveillance camera while interacting, maintaining vigilance.
Chooses to order a drink despite personal preference to avoid suspicion and maintain cover.
Engages in smooth and confident conversation with Valentin and Harmsway, demonstrating social skill and control.
Speaks politely to Sir Elliot, complimenting the boat.
Left alone with terrified Paris Harmsway after the arrest, no indication of immediate comfort or reassurance.
Maintains composure and observes attentively during the sudden arrest scene, showing situational awareness.
Does not immediately intervene or respond decisively to the arrest and chaotic situation, seemingly passive in the moment.
Moves to console Paris who is terrified and offers her protection by giving her a key to his hotel room and promising to meet her in twenty minutes.
Responds to Paris's plea to hear him say 'I love you' with a pause and deflection, prioritizing the mission over emotional connection.
Consoles Paris and quickly gives her a plan to go to his hotel room for safety, showing decisiveness and care under stress.
Pauses and deflects Paris's request for emotional reassurance to focus on the immediate mission, demonstrating prioritization and self-control.
Moves into a dangerous situation to confront Harmsway and inspect the suspicious red box, showing willingness to face risk and investigate.
Reacting with disbelief at Harmsway's claim about depleted uranium and the safety thereof, indicating some skepticism but no immediate dismissal.
Tells Don Franco to enjoy the reception politely after the confrontation.
Engages in a tense verbal exchange with Harmsway, staring him down without backing down.
Rushes back to his hotel room and calls out for Paris in concern.
Shows no immediate emotional reaction upon discovering Paris Harmsway dead, instead observes the scene.
Stares down Harmsway confidently during their confrontation, showing no intimidation.
Immediately rushes to pursue after Harmsway, quickly boarding the gondola and rushing to his hotel room.
Finds his hotel door unlocked and enters cautiously, indicating alertness.
Fails to prevent the murder of Paris Harmsway, who is found dead in the canal, suggesting a missed threat or failure to protect.
Appears devastated and crushed after discovering Paris Harmsway dead, then is immediately arrested.

Although not explicitly shown in this excerpt, the smooth orchestration of Stamper's actions and deception to safely get Number Three on the plane suggests competent planning and execution by Bond or his team.
No direct action or statement related to Bond's competence in this excerpt; the scene focuses on the ship's crew handling autopilot and sonar detection.
Detects unusual electrical emissions and reacts quickly to a sudden threat by instructing radar to be punched up and alerting crew.
Fails to anticipate large uncharted vessel blocking channel, indicating a possible gap in situational awareness.
Attempts to be polite and engaged on a dreadful first date, putting on a good face.
Addresses Moneypenny informally and immediately, showing familiarity and trust.
Maintains composure and a polite facade during an awkward fix-up date despite clear discomfort.
Answers an unexpected call quickly and with controlled tone, indicating readiness and alertness to his role.
Arrives late to a high-level meeting but apologizes promptly upon entering.
Expresses positive anticipation upon meeting Admiral Roebuck by saying 'I've looked forward to meeting you.'
Arrives late but confidently and appropriately dressed in full naval uniform, asserting his presence at a high-level meeting despite initial objections.
Acknowledges key figures with composed politeness and takes a seat calmly, showing social awareness and control.
Defends Admiral Roebuck calmly and explains the reasoning behind the electronic silence, showing understanding and fairness.

Intervenes in a tense discussion by explaining and defending the operational decision of electronic silence during a sensitive shipment, showing knowledge of standard procedures and past military incidents.
Accepts the role of observer during a critical operation when requested by the Minister, agreeing promptly and without hesitation.
Engages respectfully and thoughtfully with M, discussing observations and doubts about the mission.
Remains silent or non-committal when M instructs about finding and securing the gold.
Analyzes satellite images and deduces that the boat's disappearance does not add up based on lack of heat signatures.
Engages in conversation with M, showing awareness of political aspects and attentive to his mentor's guidance.
Recognizes the lack of clear evidence and understands the need for further investigation rather than jumping to conclusions.
Accepts M's rebuke and reorients mission focus without argument.
Pauses and listens attentively as M chastises him and redirects the mission's focus.
Shows restrained reaction (comeuppance) to M's criticism, indicating self-awareness and professional humility.
Considers pursuing a personal vendetta against Elliot Harmsway despite explicit instructions to the contrary.
Commands the crew to 'Get rid of' the HNN boat interfering with the mission.
Collaborates effectively with his crew, showing professional leadership and engagement.
Analyzes sonar data intelligently, requests another pass to confirm detection, directs removal of interfering boat.
Peers intently at the Sonar Operator's screen, actively seeking information.
Responds promptly upon receiving news about the crewman's body, indicating situational awareness.
Greets Wade with familiarity and engages in cooperative investigation without hostility.
Responds sarcastically ('That's reassuring.') but maintains professional focus and directs polite questions to local policeman.
Jumps the last ten feet onto the boat, showing physical agility and decisiveness.
Questions conflicting statements from Wade and uses skepticism to analyze the situation, showing critical thinking.
Inspects the body and notes inconsistencies in the cause of death, showing observational skill and attention to detail.
Asks the police officer to verify details about the body’s arrival based on logical deductions about currents, showing intelligence and methodical investigation.
Quickly forms a plan to use Wade's boat to continue the investigation, demonstrating resourcefulness and decisiveness.
Engages in light-hearted banter with Wade about the woman in the launch and makes a joking comment about leaving his partner, showing a sense of humor and camaraderie.
Acknowledges Wade's choice of boat and the shared mission without condescension, displaying straightforward cooperation.
Focuses on practical matters for the mission (tide charts, body location) without emotional engagement or overt friendliness toward Wade.
Politely thanks the Harbor Master and checks for unusual events, showing attentiveness to others' concerns.
Uses a fake identity signature without apparent remorse or acknowledgement.
Uses a fake name (Sidney Winch) to obtain sensitive harbor charts without raising suspicion.
Probes the harbor master about any unusual events related to weather or incidents, demonstrating situational awareness.
Identifies a potential lead (Captain Cheong) and takes initiative to arrange a meeting through appropriate channels.
Expresses sympathy when Captain Cheong talks about pirates torturing crew.
Politely thanks Captain Cheong for his time, smiling.
Makes a teasing comment to Sidney Winch about handling liquor and boats.
Introduces himself politely and offers a drink to Sidney's companion despite the menacing demeanor.
Responds to Sidney's sarcastic and challenging remarks with calm wit rather than hostility.
Makes a somewhat dismissive or teasing comment about Sidney's dinner date, ‘Pity.’
Maintains composure and confidence when confronted with Sidney and her intimidating chaperone; analyzes the situation quickly and chooses to attempt to rattle Sidney with a clever reply.
Uses charm and social skills by ordering drinks in a smooth, characteristic manner (vodka martini, shaken not stirred); engages in light banter demonstrating situational awareness.
Attempts to bluff or mislead Sidney about the true nature of his business ('insurance', 'Golden opportunity') but Sidney remains unimpressed; potential risk of giving away inaccurate information.
Maintains polite acknowledgment with Sidney - 'Nice to run into you again.'
Reacts with violent aggression by slamming Taro's head on the bar and choking him with his tie.
Takes a moment to compose himself (straightens his bow-tie) after violent act.
Greets Q warmly despite Q’s irritation.
Responds with sarcasm to Q’s technical explanations (e.g., asking if he has to dial '9' to get out).
Interrupts Q with a practical question about the car (four wheel drive).
Engages with Q to receive new equipment and gadgets, asking relevant questions about the car's capabilities.
Seems unfamiliar with technical jargon (asks Q to explain the retrograde analysis in English), showing limited understanding of sophisticated analysis tools.
Tests the car's remote control immediately and understands its functions quickly.
Makes a lighthearted comment to Q about his retirement and granddaughters.
Nods and looks distractedly at girls in bikinis.
Focuses on sonar display and gives clear instructions to slow down and cut engines during the search.
Concentrates on sonar display and correctly identifies the location of a hidden ship despite doubts.
Shows calm command by instructing to slow down and cut the engines to avoid detection.
Half-teasing comment to Wade about pirates, showing light-hearted interaction.
Enters dangerous underwater mission calmly and without complaint, showing professional but emotionally distant behavior.
Acknowledges the risk of deep air diving but decides to do a bounce dive to keep bottom time short, showing awareness and calculated risk-taking.
Carefully monitors air gauge and depth, showing skill and cautiousness under dangerous conditions.
Uses a flare underwater to illuminate and explore the environment effectively.
Pauses to study damage underwater and examines marks carefully before proceeding.
Carefully retrieves items of interest (gold bar, uranium tooth) from the dangerous underwater environment, showing focus and composure.
Cuts the cord to his gold/uranium sack and uses a diver as a hostage to survive, showing resourcefulness and pragmatism.
Holds a knife to a diver's throat to gain an advantage.
After being caught, releases the hostage by sticking the knife into the deck.
Realizes his best chance is to take one of the men hostage, acts decisively by cutting the cord and attempting to overpower a diver with a knife.
Despite initial success, gets caught in a dolphin net triggered by a second diver, showing a moment where his plan is foiled.
Maintains composure and sarcasm when confronted by armed enemies, sticks knife into deck and releases hostage, showing confidence under pressure.
Smiles wryly at the crew member sharpening a machete, showing composure and mild humor under threat.
Tries to excuse Sidney's antagonistic behavior by suggesting it isn't truly in her nature, showing tolerance and understanding.
Introduces Wade to Sidney, facilitating cordial interaction despite tense circumstances.
Calmly assesses a threatening situation and correctly judges that Sidney Winch will not kill him and Wade, showing good situational awareness and interpersonal insight.
Engages in light banter with Wade and Sidney under pressure, maintaining composure and demonstrating confidence.
Engages in light, playful banter with Sidney showing a joking, less hostile side (e.g. 'The family jewels?')
Allows Sidney to search him and tolerates her rough teasing ('Think about mom.' / 'Unusual technique.'), showing patience and restraint
Uses sarcasm to deflate Sidney's aggressive claim about the gold ('one third of nothing is still nothing') which could be seen as dismissive
Makes a clever and confident retort about 'one third of nothing is still nothing,' showing awareness of the situation's implications.
Maintains calm and humor when Sidney reaches into his trunks, indicating composure under pressure.
Keeps his focus on the uranium tooth despite the distraction of impending danger, evidencing situational awareness and intelligence.
Hesitates and is physically nudged away by Taro instead of proactively escaping or seizing the uranium tooth.
Exchanges an amused/helpless glance with Wade about the standoff, showing lightheartedness in a tense situation.
Observes Taro cowering and notes 'Gatling gun beats Uzi', showing a detached, slightly mocking attitude toward fear.
Remains calm and composed under enemy fire, does not dive for cover while others do, demonstrating confidence and situational awareness.
Tries to warn Sidney against hostile actions, showing attempt at tactical communication and risk assessment.
Acknowledges the relative firepower advantage with a concise comment ('Gatling gun beats Uzi'), indicating battlefield knowledge and clear-headedness.
Identifies himself calmly when questioned by Captain Morton.
Is stunned and struggles ineffectively when Marines move in on him.
Attempts to intervene verbally by saying 'Wait a minute' but fails to prevent arrest.
Answers unknown secure call cautiously but politely.
Decides on next steps despite uncertainty, choosing to press for answers in Kuala Lumpur.
Notices details on the incoming call’s digital display and reacts with curiosity before answering.
Answers an unknown secure call cautiously, immediately questions the caller's identity.
Interacts politely and lightly teases the PR woman about parking his car himself, making a small joke about its temperamental nature.
Shows renewed determination and focus on the mission after arranging to meet Harmsway, but without any emotional expression or warmth towards others.
Immediately agrees to meet Harmsway and drives with renewed determination, showing decisiveness and focus.
Insists on parking his own car despite convenience, citing temperamental behavior and preparing for a quick getaway, demonstrating foresight and control.
Observes surroundings carefully while parking, indicating situational awareness.
Responds politely to Harmsway's greeting with 'Sir Elliot'.
Follows the PR woman cooperatively through security procedures without complaint.
Removes and hides his gun discreetly inside his car before entering the building.
Plans quick get-away, scans security devices carefully, hides gun discreetly in car compartment.
Follows PR woman's lead without obvious suspicion or resistance.
Smiles wryly and exchanges a sardonic remark with Harmsway, showing engagement but with a hint of detachment.
Acknowledges Harmsway's pain by saying 'I can feel your pain...', expressing a modicum of empathy.
Clocks the security camera in the elevator ceiling upon entering, demonstrating awareness of surroundings and security measures.
Engages Harmsway with calm, pointed remarks suggesting psychological insight and conversational control.
Responds wittily to Harmsway's comment about the portraits, demonstrating quick thinking and social confidence.
Gives a brief, somewhat evasive answer ('Sightseeing') when asked about his purpose in Kuala Lumpur, indicating controlled and deliberate communication.
Jokes wryly about the use of satellites for disinformation, showing a dry sense of humor that lightly engages with Harmsway.
Comments cynically on the news content ('And still not a thing to watch'), indicating a skeptical and somewhat dismissive attitude rather than friendliness or sincerity.
Makes a quick, insightful observation about the possibility of satellites being used to beam disinformation, showing technical knowledge and strategic thinking.
Displays a sarcastic comment dismissing the overwhelming broadcast media as 'not a thing to watch,' indicating confidence and critical judgment.
Responds briefly and politely when Sidney is suspicious of him; remains composed despite frustration with Harmsway.
Maintains composure and shows frustration internally but does not lose his cool in face of Harmsway's taunts and provocations.
Allows himself to be brought into Harmsway's office and situation without visible resistance or countermeasure, potentially revealing a lapse in tactical guardedness.
Attempts to de-escalate the situation by suggesting leaving it to Sidney and Harmsway, showing concern for safety.
Does not stop Sidney from exposing evidence despite knowing the danger, showing some trust in her judgment.
Recognizes the threat Harmsway poses and tries to intervene but is politely blocked, indicating cautiousness and protective instincts.
Knows that if the evidence is shown, Harmsway will likely kill them both; reacts with appropriate concern.
Attempts to verbally intervene to prevent Sidney from revealing further evidence.
Fails to physically or otherwise stop Sidney from dropping the evidence despite recognizing the danger.
Warns Sidney about imminent danger and tries to protect her by looking for an escape, asks if she has a gun to defend themselves.
Immediately assesses the situation in the elevator, notices the security camera, and looks for an escape panel, showing situational awareness and quick thinking.
Disables security camera proactively despite not having his gun, demonstrating resourcefulness and skill under pressure.
Warns Sidney firmly about imminent danger and insists on being armed, showing confidence and control of the situation.
Explains the situation calmly and logically while working to open the escape panel under pressure.
Recognizes the suspicious elevator behavior and chooses to go up instead of down, showing situational awareness.
Attempts to get Sidney to come with him for safety, showing leadership and concern.
Sidney refuses to follow Bond's lead, which can imply a failed attempt to assert control, but this is Sidney's choice, not Bond's failure per se.
Shields Sidney from gunfire by pressing his body against her and helps her escape.
Offers Sidney help and a lift out of danger.
Advises office workers waiting for the elevator on how to exit safely.
Swings down from escape panel like an athlete, kicks enemies away, rescues Sidney, shields her from gunfire, opens latch to escape elevator shaft, escapes successfully ahead of enemies.
Tells office workers politely to try the stairs instead of elevator, showing awareness of their situation.
Protects Sidney by telling her to wait but accepts her decision to come along without argument.
Stops to assess danger carefully and acts decisively to incapacitate a guard to protect themselves.
Pushes Sidney into an open doorway to protect her during a gunfight.
Encourages Sidney by giving her simple advice and involving her actively in defense ('Shoot back!').
Uses humor and lightness in an intense situation ('Come here. You shoot. I'll cook.').
Immediately returns fire accurately under attack, protects Sidney by pushing her into safety.
Quickly improvises by using kitchen supplies and opens toner cartridge to create an impromptu device.
Coaches Sidney to shoot back despite her fear, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Kneels beside Sidney, covers her and protects her during gunfire.
Engages in light banter joking about Sidney's career shifts despite danger.
Focuses primarily on timing the bomb and escape, shows limited emotional engagement beyond tactical necessity.
Focuses on tactical survival and escape, shoots at enemies without hesitation.
Uses a burst of gunfire to cover their escape and quickly improvises by grabbing a MAC-10 from a dead guard.
Shoots bullets that inadvertently destroy a jug of cleaner, using it as a distraction against pursuers.
Effectively directs Sidney in their movement up and down the stairwell while maintaining offensive actions against guards.
Recognizes and exploits environmental tools, such as the pneumatic nail gun, to secure their position and delay pursuers.
Encourages Sidney to take a risky action but does so with a lighthearted tone, 'Sometimes, you just have to take the plunge.'
Asks for help moving the window washer's rig, involving Sidney in the effort.
Fires nails to buy time by securing the door frame.
Strategically chooses to use a window washer's rig to descend from the 72nd floor, assessing the environment carefully before acting.
Calmly encourages Sidney to take a risky action ('take the plunge') despite her apprehension.
Operates the window washer rig efficiently, controlling descent speed and path while ensuring cover.
Grabs Sidney to prevent her from falling when the rig swings precariously above the sky bridge.
Responds to Sidney's panic with a simple 'Trust me' despite the tension, attempting to reassure her.
Focuses on survival and mission priority, shooting Stamper to neutralize threat without showing hesitation or concern for him.
Fires a precise shot at Stamper to stop him from causing further harm.
Grabs Sidney to prevent her from falling when the rig swings dangerously.
Responds to Sidney’s panic with a calm 'Trust me' despite uncertain circumstances.
Shoots out the adjacent window as a bold and risky move to escape the halted rig.
Grabs Sidney to protect her as the cable drops, ensuring her safety in a life-threatening situation.
Moves quickly to protect Sidney during attack, instructs her calmly and helps secure her with harness to escape danger together.
Interrupts Sidney to focus on immediate threat, cutting off conversation.
Quickly devises a plan to use cable loops and a harness to rappel down the railing, demonstrating practical problem-solving under pressure.
Effectively instructs Sidney how to secure herself to him and trust the plan despite her doubts, showing leadership and confidence.
Responds to incoming gunfire by firing back and using the environment to escape, showing tactical skill and calm under fire.
Accepts responsibility and maintains focus despite Sidney blaming half the situation on him, indicating emotional control and professionalism.
Reassures Sidney with a dry joke while in a dangerous situation, pulls them safely onto the balcony.
Uses the cable to slow the fall and successfully pulls himself and Sidney to safety on the balcony despite the extreme danger.
Quickly assesses the environment upon entering the press room and uses surroundings (crane with newsprint roll) as an improvised weapon against guards.
Works with Sidney to fight off multiple guards and protects Sidney by pulling him away from danger at the last moment.
Shoots the hook on the crane carrying the newsprint roll, causing it to crash on the guards.
Engages in a physical fight with a large pressman, ultimately forcing the man into an ink drum and then escaping with Sidney.
After being tripped by a guard, quickly recovers by kicking the guard and then flipping the baling switch to tie him up.
Rushing the last guard to save Sidney and knocking him into the printing press rollers, effectively neutralizing him.
Protects Sidney by rushing the guard and pulling Sidney away from danger.
Throws a look to his car and schemes a way out despite being under threat.
Protects Sidney by pulling her behind cover during gunfire.
Displays quick thinking and cooperation by offering to drive while Sidney shoots.
Momentarily acknowledges Sidney's capability when she insists she is not helpless.
Teases Sidney about relationship issues, showing a slightly sarcastic tone.
Palms the car remote control covertly, manipulating it while pretending compliance to buy time.
